review_blob: I dont write many reviews but this deserved one. Very sweet. So much citrus. Goes down smoothly. It has so much more balance than other IPAs. Im also glad they didnt just make a stronger Furious. This is a completely different beer. Its the perfect DIPA in my opinion.

Bottle. Ive had a lot of torpedo and this is a good change up that is perfect for the season. Pours a great red-orange color. Same palate as torpedo with about the same amount of alcohol. This is a great alternative to the average ipa. Glad costco has a 24 pack
From a bottle into duvel tulip. Tastes like dark fruit and a bit of black licorice. Color is great. Very satisfied with this wonderful beer. One of the best I have had.

This is the first barrel-aged beer I have had so I didnt have much to compare it to. I could definitely taste the bourbon aging and it is absolutely delicious. Overall the beer is kind of sweet. Best porter I have had although I havent had too many porters. I cant wait to get back to the U.S. and try some other barrel-aged beers.
beer_name: Garage Project Lord Cockswains Courage Bourbon Barrel-Aged

review_blob: From a bottle. Pours a nice golden color. Tastes like an APA should. Hides the 6% well. This is much better than I was expecting. Best beer Ive had in New Zealand so far (havent had too many yet). +1 for the cool bottle

I really enjoy this IPA for some reason, maybe its the amazing can design. Tastes a lot like Ranger from NB. Nice 6.5% ABV that can be tasted. Has a very smooth finish for an IPA so its very drinkable for 6.5. Got to support one of the few brews from SD
